title: Sparkler
text: Using Sparkler Shiny requires slightly different mental model standard plots. Concept: place Output function UI, unlike plot, takes 0 pixels space. acts invisible ‚Äúantenna.‚Äù send data Server, triggers JavaScript engine paint whole screen.

title: Sparkler
code: library(shiny) library(sparkler)  ui <- fluidPage(   titlePanel("Sales Dashboard"),      # 1. The Trigger   actionButton("btn_success", "Close Deal"),      # 2. The Invisible Antenna (Place this anywhere in UI)   confettiOutput("celebration_effect") )  server <- function(input, output) {      # 3. The Logic   observeEvent(input$btn_success, {     output$celebration_effect <- renderConfetti({       # Triggers the effect       confetti(particle_count = 150, spread = 100)      })   }) }  shinyApp(ui, server)

text: particle_count Integer. Number particles fire (default 150). spread Integer. wide explosion degrees (default 100). width Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number. height Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number. elementId Use explicit element ID widget (optional). outputId output variable read expr expression generates confetti env environment evaluate expr. quoted expr quoted expression (quote())?

code: weather(   type = "snow",   density = 1,   speed = 1,   fullscreen = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   elementId = NULL )  weatherOutput(outputId, width = "100%", height = "0px")  renderWeather(expr, env = parent.frame(), quoted = FALSE)

title: Start Weather Effect ‚Äî weather
text: type Character. One "snow", "rain", "meteor", "none" (stop effect). density Numeric. Multiplier particle count (default 1). speed Numeric. Multiplier movement speed (default 1). fullscreen Logical. TRUE, forces effect cover whole page (useful RMarkdown). NULL (default), auto-detects Shiny. width Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number. height Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number. elementId Optional ID. outputId output variable read expr expression generates weather env environment evaluate expr. quoted expr quoted expression?
